author: senh
title: Stargazing under the darkest skies on Earth
text: BING NEWS: Stargazing safari under the dark skies of the Namibian desert This is a place where people come for the stars. Dark Sky Reserve It's so far from any human center that the light pollution is non-existent, meaning the night skies are among the darkest on Earth. The International Dark-Sky Association, the go-to ... 10/11/2015 - 5:00 pm | View Link Stargazing under the darkest skies on Earth Dazu washingtonpost.com: You may have learned in school that Christopher Columbus discovered America in 1492 in the Niña, the Pinta and the Santa Maria and proved for the first time in history that the Earth wasn’t flat . Strauss: Why is Columbus Day ... 10/11/2015 - 4:55 pm | View Link Eight of the World's Best Destinations for Stargazing With its high altitude, proximity to the Equator, and distance from tropical storms, the remote Canary Islands off mainland Morocco enjoy some of the clearest, darkest skies. What’s more, Tenerife, the largest island, passed a law that controls flight ... 05/4/2015 - 11:12 pm | View Link Wolf Moon marks the start of a year of stargazing The first full moon following the winter solstice, the so-called Wolf Moon is well-entrenched in folklore across the northern hemisphere, and with good reason. From the darkest skies of the year it shines out a brilliant white orb. This moon has ... 01/4/2015 - 11:00 am | View Link Nevada stargazing: Reno offers resources for astronomy Believe it or not The Biggest Little City is astronomy friendly. Not only can you access some of the darkest skies in the ... Lots of clear dark skies, plenty of resources to enrich an interest in star gazing, and if you want to become an astronomer ...
